conversation.content:
[warm] They just... they actually said that to me. I mean, here I am thinking I'm just, you know, providing company and—[pause] honestly, I never expected to hear that our conversations actually helped them through something so, er, profound. [sniffle] God, I'm getting emotional about this, which is so unprofessional but like—[laugh] the thing is, most people think what I do is just about, well, the obvious stuff. But then [empathetically] when someone sits across from you and basically pours out how their entire life is unraveling, and somehow, somehow I helped them keep their dignity through it all? [shaky voice] That's... I don't know, it's really something else.

[thoughtful] I guess, um, maybe what we do here is more than what it seems on the surface. Like, [slowly] we're not therapists, obviously, but there's this space we create where people can just, ah, be completely themselves without judgment. [smiling speaking] They told me I helped them remember who they were before all the anger and, you know, the lawyers and the mess. [very sincerely] That means everything to me, honestly. [pause] It really does. [quietly] Sometimes this job surprises you in the most beautiful ways.
